titleStmt.title: [Letter] 1815 Jun. 30, Nashville, Tennessee [to] J[ames] Winchester, Cragfont, Tennessee / Jo[natha]n Anderson : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Anderson, Jno.

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: 1815 Jun. 30, Nashville, Tennessee [to] J[ames] Winchester, Cragfont, Tennessee / Jo[natha]n Anderson
bibl.author: Anderson, Jno.
bibl.note: This is a letter from Jonathan Anderson to James Winchester, dated June 30, 1815. Anderson is writing on behalf of the Bank of Nashville. He is explaining to Winchester why the bank will not take his North Carolina bank notes.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p: We cannot give Nashville Bank notes in exchange for North Carolina Notes___ From persons in Business who deposit the cash they receive of every description, North Carolina state bank notes are taken in deposit, and even in this way are extremely inconvenient to us,_____ In no other way can we receive such notes, and we avoid them every way as much as possible

closer.salute:
very respectfully
your Obedt Obedient Servant
